I tried to find equality criterion for Cauchy-Schwarz inequality (the inequality), when it is case of sums in real numbers over Finsets.

Closest I could find was more general case with inner product and norm: docs#inner_eq_norm_mul_iff

I had difficulties using this general version to prove the simpler case I wanted. :(

Maybe someone has done it already?
This is for the inequality. It is useful (i'm using it already) but not a criterion for the case when there's equality.

My current version which works:

import Mathlib

lemma fin_Cauchy_Schwarz_equality_criterion n (f g: Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù):
    (‚àë i, f i * g i) = ‚àö(‚àë i, f i ^ 2) * ‚àö(‚àë i, g i ^ 2) ‚Üî
    (‚àÄ i, ‚àö(‚àë i, g i ^ 2) * f i = ‚àö(‚àë i, f i ^ 2) * g i) := by
  set x: EuclideanSpace ‚Ñù (Fin n) := (WithLp.equiv _ _).symm f
  set y: EuclideanSpace ‚Ñù (Fin n) := (WithLp.equiv _ _).symm g
  have H := inner_eq_norm_mul_iff_real (x := x) (y := y)
  simp [x, y] at H
  have Ht (t: Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù): ‚Äñ(WithLp.equiv 2 (Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù)).symm t‚Äñ = ‚àö(‚àë i, (t i) ^ 2) := by
    unfold WithLp.equiv
    unfold Equiv.refl
    simp
    unfold norm
    unfold PiLp.instNorm
    simp
    have H0: 0 ‚â§ ‚àë i, t i ^ 2 := by
      apply Finset.sum_nonneg
      intros i
      simp
      apply sq_nonneg (t i)
    refine (Real.rpow_inv_eq H0 ?_ ?_).mpr ?_
    . apply Real.sqrt_nonneg
    . norm_num
    . rw [‚Üê Real.rpow_div_two_eq_sqrt 2 H0]
      simp
  simp_rw [Ht] at H
  have H0: ‚àë x, g x * f x = ‚àë x, f x * g x := by
    congr
    ext x
    apply mul_comm
  rw [H0] at H
  rw [H]
  have Ht0 (k: ‚Ñù) (t: Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù): k ‚Ä¢ (WithLp.equiv 2 (Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù)).symm t = fun x => k * t x := by
    congr
  rw [Ht0, Ht0]
  constructor <;> intro H1
  . rw [funext_iff] at H1
    exact H1
  . rw [funext_iff]
    exact H1
